page.title: 16CROPWELL BUTLER W. I.
page.content: On the first Thursday evening of each month some 50 ladies of 17-91 years hurry to the Village Hall (as they have done for the past 65 years) to attend the{Institute}meeting. Here, for example, they discuss national issues, or learn about the National Trust or British Telecom, watch a make-up demonstration, and chatter one with another. The December meeting is a Christmas Party. The August meeting is an outing; this year a cruise on the canal was followed by supper at a wharfside restaurant. In July a Garden Party is held to raise funds to provide a Christmas present to every- one in the parish over the age of 70. This year we were awarded the Silver Trophy at the Newark Show for the best entry in the Notts. Federation of Women's Institutes.
